metadata.entity_name: Photographic Film, Paper, Plate, and Chemical Manufacturing

title: Photographic Film, Paper, Plate, and Chemical Manufacturing

industry_name.value: Photographic Film, Paper, Plate, and Chemical Manufacturing

cross_references.text: photographic film, paper, plate, and chemical manufacturing
cross_references.name: Photographic Film, Paper, Plate, and Chemical Manufacturing

description.value: This U.S. industry comprises establishments primarily engaged in manufacturing sensitized film, sensitized paper, sensitized cloth, sensitized plates, toners (i.e., for photocopiers, laser printers, and similar electrostatic printing devices), toner cartridges, and photographic chemicals.

job_tasks.value: High risk job tasks associated with this industry: Formulate, mold, or cure resins to produce advanced composite materials Use diazonium salts to manufacture photocopy paper or polymers Use epoxy, isocyanate, or formaldehyde-resin adhesives, finishes, or sealants Use solder containing colophony, zinc chloride, ethanolamine, or ammonium chloride flux
